title: MPH: How Monaco GP might go from procession to pandemonium
summary: This yearâ€™s Monaco Grand Prix brings the prospect of unprecedented chaos and intrigue, as the new two-stop rule throws strategy - and the race outcome - wide open.Mark Hughesexplains

qa_pairs.question: What is the significance of the two-stop rule in Formula 1 races?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: It allows teams to change tires twice during a race, potentially altering strategies and outcomes.
wrong_options: It restricts teams to only one tire change.
It mandates all drivers to start on hard tires.
It prevents drivers from pitting during the race.

qa_pairs.question: Why is the Monaco Grand Prix often considered a challenging race for overtaking?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: The narrow and winding streets make it difficult to pass other cars.
wrong_options: It has the longest straight on the calendar.
The track is very wide, allowing for easy overtaking.
There are multiple DRS zones available throughout the lap.

qa_pairs.question: What impact can changing strategies have on the outcome of a Formula 1 race?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: It can create opportunities for drivers to gain positions or lose time based on tire performance.
wrong_options: It has no impact on the race outcome.
It only affects drivers who start in the top positions.
It guarantees a faster lap time for all drivers.
